00073   template<
00074     typename ElementType,
00075     typename WeightType = double,
00076     typename WeightAccessor = mp_weight_accessor<WeightType, ElementType>
00077   > class is_picked_systematic
00078   {
00079   private:
00080     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT((std::numeric_limits<WeightType>::is_integer == false));
00081   public:
00082     typedef ElementType element_type;
00083     typedef WeightType weight_type;
00084     typedef WeightAccessor weight_accessor_type;
00085     
00092     is_picked_systematic() :
00093       sampleSize_(0),
00094       populationWeight_(0)
00095       {
00096         initialize( 0 );
00097       }
00098     
00124     is_picked_systematic(size_t sampleSize,
00125                          WeightType populationWeight,
00126                          WeightAccessor const& wac = WeightAccessor()) :
00127       wac_(wac), sampleSize_(sampleSize),
00128       populationWeight_(populationWeight)
00129       {
00130         initialize( rand_gen::uniform_01<WeightType>() );
00131       }
00132 
00164     is_picked_systematic(size_t sampleSize,
00165                          WeightType populationWeight,
00166                          WeightType uniform01,
00167                          WeightAccessor const& wac = WeightAccessor()) :
00168       wac_(wac), sampleSize_(sampleSize),
00169       populationWeight_(populationWeight)
00170       {
00171         initialize(uniform01);
00172       }
00173 
00181     bool operator()(const ElementType & e)
00182       {
00183         if (sampleSize_ == 0) return false;
00184         
00185 #ifdef TRSL_USE_SYSTEMATIC_INTUITIVE_ALGORITHM
00186         // This algorithm is the intuitive implementation of
00187         // systematic sampling, where one pictures a wheel with
00188         // N_SAMPLE spokes and distributes the population around the
00189         // wheel as segments of tire of length proportional to their
00190         // weight; the spokes point to picked elements.
00191         WeightType arrow = k_*step_;
00192         assert(cumulative_ <= arrow);
00193         if (arrow < cumulative_ + wac_(e))
00194         {
00195           k_++;
00196           return true;
00197         }
00198         cumulative_ += wac_(e);
00199         return false;
00200 #else
00201         // This algorithm is a massaged version of the intuitive
00202         // algorithm.  Both algorithms are conceptually identical, but
00203         // this version is faster.
00204         assert(position_ >= 0);
00205         if (position_ < wac_(e))
00206         {
00207           position_ += step_;
00208           return true;
00209         }
00210         position_ -= wac_(e);
00211         return false;
00212 #endif
00213       }
00214 
00226     bool is_first_pick(const ElementType & e) const
00227     {
00228       if (wac_(e) <= step_) return true;
00229 #ifdef TRSL_USE_SYSTEMATIC_INTUITIVE_ALGORITHM
00230       return k_*step_ - cumulative_ < 2*step_;
00231 #else
00232       return position_ < 2*step_;
00233 #endif      
00234     }
00235 
00243     bool operator== (const is_picked_systematic<ElementType, WeightType, WeightAccessor> &p) const
00244       {
00245         if (sampleSize_ != p.sampleSize_ ||
00246             populationWeight_ != p.populationWeight_) return false;
00247 
00248 #ifdef TRSL_USE_SYSTEMATIC_INTUITIVE_ALGORITHM
00249         if (cumulative_ != p.cumulative_ ||
00250             k_ != p.k_) return false;
00251 #else
00252         if (position_ != p.position_) return false;
00253 #endif
00254         
00255         return true;
00256       }
00257       
00258   private:
00259     void initialize(WeightType randomReal)
00260       {
00261         // If one could rely on
00262         //
00263         //   (x!=0.0)/0.0 == inf (with the sign of x)
00264         //
00265         // and on
00266         //
00267         //   0.0 * inf == NaN,
00268         //
00269         // neither of these throwing exceptions, then the following
00270         // block could be avoided, and the case sampleSize_ == 0 would
00271         // be implicitly handled by inf/NaN arithmetic.
00272         //
00273         // However, it would be necessary to maintain two different
00274         // implementations depending on
00275         // std::numeric_limits<double>::is_iec559, and even then I'm
00276         // not sure if inf/NaN arithmetic is reliable.
00277         if (sampleSize_ != 0)
00278           step_ = populationWeight_ / sampleSize_;
00279         else
00280           // A semantically correct value for step_ would be inf, but
00281           // we don't want to get into has_infinity trouble...
00282           // When sampleSize_==0, step_ should be considered undefined.
00283           step_ = 0;
00284         
00285         WeightType randomWeight = randomReal * step_;
00286 #ifdef TRSL_USE_SYSTEMATIC_INTUITIVE_ALGORITHM
00287         cumulative_ = -randomWeight;
00288         k_ = 0;
00289 #else
00290         position_ = randomWeight;
00291 #endif
00292       }
00293 
00294   private:
00295     WeightAccessor wac_;
00296     size_t sampleSize_;
00297     WeightType populationWeight_;
00298     WeightType step_;
00299   
00300 #ifdef TRSL_USE_SYSTEMATIC_INTUITIVE_ALGORITHM
00301     WeightType cumulative_;
00302     size_t k_;
00303 #else
00304     WeightType position_;
00305 #endif
00306   };

00320   template<class Iterator>
00321   bool is_first_pick(const Iterator& i)
00322   {
00323     return i.predicate().is_first_pick(*i);
00324   }
